Reviews.Title: “It couldn't be any better.... Just Perfect....!!”
Reviews.Author: DocTariq
Reviews.Content: We visited in march 2012 and it was splendid.... the location, the environment, the hospatality, the room, evrythng was jux perfect. Loved the place and loved Istanbul... Our trip was awesome and life time memorable.... great job.

Reviews.Title: “February 2012”
Reviews.Author: Panagiotis F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a 4 bedroom suite (heading to Bosporus) with an excellent view. The service from the staff was excellent and specially from Volkan.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Amany731
Reviews.Content: I go to Istanbul often for business , I find Taksim Hill hotel very Practical for all my needs, the staff is very friendly and they provide all kind of assistance the only one thing is the TV channels is limited but other wise I love it

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, good service”
Reviews.Author: deniz o
Reviews.Content: excellent service, clean rooms, some details were better than the 5 star hotels. very good price, great breakfast. i was not expecting this and suprised, good value and perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Good experience in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Experience2011
Reviews.Content: I was far too worried after reading all the -ve reviews BUT I have to disagree with all of them as Taxim Hill hotel is a nice, friendly hotel located in a very convenient spot...

Reviews.Title: “Expecting the worse, pleasantly suprised!”
Reviews.Author: sneezing7
Reviews.Content: My reservation was made by a colleague of mine in Istanbul. After reading reviews on the hotel at the last minute I was expecting a horrible hell hole. Instead, my stay was pleasant and I would have no hesitations staying there again. The staff were more than courteous and willing to help with any questions I had. The room was large and clean. Breakfast could do with some more variety, but nonetheless what was on offer was fresh and tasty. Negatives: Very difficult to establish a stable wifi connection in the room.Walls are a bit thin - could hear some over enthusiastic activities going on next door!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want your possessions stolen”
Reviews.Author: themizzvee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks 2010. In that time most of my Jewellery was stolen. Two rings, 3 sets if earrings ( these were gifts ) and a pendant that has huge sentimental value. The staff when confronted called me a liar, and basically fobbed me off. When I pushed the issue they threatened me! Would never stay here again. From other peoples reviews I can see this is not a one off occurrence. I also stayed at the divan hotel, which I would highly recommend. I stayed here for business and was lucky enough to be moved there. It's a real shame because the hotel is in a brilliant location. Right by the square, and what I call kebab ally. Avoid this hotel at all costs. Maybe a dip in their customer base will make them take the thefts in the hotel seriously. Wish I'd called the police.

Reviews.Title: “One thing: Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: spicydiamond
Reviews.Content: First of all, we went there desperately looking for a room because we booked an appartment for the week and it turn out catastrophic. The night receptionnist was really friendly so we agreed to take one suite room for 4 persons and one double room for 2 for three nights with possiblity of extension. It turns out superb. The room is clean, comfortable and spacious with view at Bosphorus. The concierge said this hotel opened only 2 months ago. Ok, so we expected good services that can boost their reputation. BUT!!! Had safety box problem, asked for help, no one came. Room cleaners turned the A/C off everytime they passed by even if it's 34Â°C outside! Asked to extend our stay but they decided to change the suite for 4 into a suite for 3 plus a foldable bed but for the same price saying that the previous suite was already booked a month ago by a family. No security in front of the hotel at night even though they're right in front of Taksim square. Not much variation of the breakfast each morning. Still lot of missing things for this hotel to make it look professional (no hotel brochure, no list of things in the mini bar, no telephone access). When we tried to deal our extended stay, they changed the receptionnist 3 times so that no one knows about our specific request. AND on top of all, they charged us 40 euros of stuff we "tooked" from the mini bar when we don't even remember the existence of it. Didn't pay, signed the paper that we had nothing to do with it and took the exit door as to never come back.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul's most secure hotel.. NO WAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Berrin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel were robbed while we sleeping, and none of us did not quite enough about security, we only lost our property, but could lose our life and all our holidays are poison and nothing.. I do not recommend you to go to this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ninova
Reviews.Content: I had a taksim square view which was pretty awesome. There were not much noise coming from outside. The location is was perfect. Subway/metro and bus station close by. The breakfast was good but same stuff everyday. Staff English was below average. The rooms were all clean. Last day during our check out they kind of tried to rip us off for extra dollars so becareful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I Have Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Guybrush1882
Reviews.Content: Aside from the excellent location on Taksim Square, this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff is very young, and is unhelpful to the point of hostility. We stayed on New Year's Eve, and were booked into a tiny interior room barely large enough for the bed. The room was as hot as a sauna, and it was impossible to sleep, even after the ill tempered staff finally produced a fan. The New Year's Eve party on the top floor echoed through the hotel's hollow interior, so our entire night we endured thumping bass. For this miserable, exhausting experience, we paid $145. The next morning, after inquiring at the front desk about laundry service, we turned over about 15 items to be laundered. They were returned one hour later, along with a bill for $142 (that's U.S. dollars). Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Far Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: tripwitch
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations before reading reviews here and couldn t cancel after. Being prepared for all troubles, we found the room spacious, clean and well air-conditioned. And as a suprise we have a jacuzzi. Yes, room was not very well decorated, and noise of Taksim Square was a little disturbing but, i think advantages make this hotel eligible.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience at the Taksim Hill”
Reviews.Author: pudra
Reviews.Content: I have two nights there. Hotel was called "special class" but there is no speciality. There are two types of rooms, rooms that have access to outside and interior rooms. Unfortunately i have stayed at one of the interior one. There was no proper air ventilation system, room was like a gas chamber. Cleaning of the room was also not ok. You can feel the dirt over the carpet even if your room was cleaned. My bathroom was bigger than my room :) (room 301). Bathroom was not well decorated and there was a bad smell. Room also was not well decorated, especially bed was short. Only good thing was the minibar.

Reviews.Title: “"Special class" hotel - but not in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: cat_mandu1
Reviews.Content: I was booked here through a Turkish friend's travel agent - what a disappointment! I thought the hotel was incredibly overpriced for what I got (and I paid a discount to the rack rate), and would rank it by US standards as a 1 or 1.5 star hotel at best. (As an aside, do not believe the star rankings on any Turkish hotel â€“ using a scale based on the â€œ4 starâ€� and â€œ5 starâ€� hotels I stayed at in Turkey, something like the Ritz-Carlton would be around 20 stars. Meanwhile, the Taxim Hill is rated â€œspecial classâ€�, and if you think about what â€œspecial educationâ€� means or meant in the United States, you'll get the picture!) The hotel is directly on Taxim Square across from the monument, and the taxis and the traffic and the horns and the people and the police/ ambulance/ fire sirens never stop - the noise is incredible. Even with the windows closed, the curtains drawn, and earplugs from the plane flight in place, I was unable to sleep, and it was too loud to talk on the telephone in my room which was in the front of the hotel. The back rooms are apparently quieter than the front rooms but it was all relative - you still wouldnâ€™t want to leave the windows open due to the noise from the air conditioners on the surrounding buildings and from the overflow noise from Taxim Square. There were also a couple of extremely tiny inside rooms on most floors that opened on the central airshaft/ lobby that runs the entire height of the hotel â€“ thankfully I wasnâ€™t in one of them but I saw them when the maid was cleaning, and they were probably 8 foot square at best, and I would imagine they were also very noisy since the hotel lobby was loud, the elevators ran through the lobby/ airshaft and the top floor restaurant became a disco after hours. The rooms are idiosyncratic (each one I saw had a different layout), but all shared being small with filthy carpet, moldy dirty bathrooms, peeling/ torn/ dirty wall paper, and rock-hard beds with thin pillows. The AC either does not work or barely works (including in the lobby), and you cannot open the windows due to the noise. The internet is sporadic - some rooms have wired internet that works, some rooms have wired internet that doesn't work, and some rooms have unsecured wireless internet that may or may not work (this includes the lobby!) I had better luck pirating a signal from one of the adjacent buildings than I did connecting to the Taxim Hillâ€™s internet, and everyone else I talked to also had internet connection issues. There are no smoke-free rooms or areas and the lobby reeks. (While the breakfast restaurant is posted as smoke-free, you would never be able to tell by the smell.) As soon as someone in one of the adjacent rooms lit up, my room immediately filled with smoke. There is no in-room safe so the only option for valuables is to take them with you or leave them with the front desk (which also didn't have a safe but where the desk staff said they would watch them.) However since there wasn't anyone behind the front desk half of the time I went past it, I lugged my laptop all over Istanbul!)However each room did have an overpriced in-room mini-bar. (The hotel obviously had its priorities straight for the business travelers it supposedly caters to!) While friendly, the staff may or may not speak English and may or may not be helpful. The breakfast is included but was very indifferent and did not change from day to day. Only pluses - the breakfast room does have a nice view of the Bosporus, and being directly on Taxim Square meant the train and buses were directly across the street and Istikal Caddesi (sort of the Rodeo Drive of Istanbul) was around the corner, giving you an infinite number of dining choices above and beyond the Taxim Hill's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: peterg44
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night after seeing the awful room presented to me. It was in the centre of the hotel and overlooked a staircase. It was tiny and did not in any way meet the hotel's advertised quality. Despite knowing my wife was coming the next day, this awful hotel and its awful reception desk staff gave me this terrible room. I moved out immediately next day and stayed in the Intecontinental. What a difference. I did ask the desk staff how much they would be paying me to stay in this hotel. They did not care anyway. When I was moving out on the Saturday, there was a steady stream of people asking to change rooms. Take advice from the wise, experienced traveller - this hotel is one to miss..

Reviews.Title: “The Taxim Hill Hotel, much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: tal39
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Taxim Hill Hotel for 3 nights and our room was located to the front side. The room and the bathroom were clean and we did not have any complaints. The food of the restaurant is good. Only the breakfast could be better but the view down to the Bosporus was gorgeous. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: amberm1
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel that my company uses when someone travels to Istanbul. I called it home for 3 weeks. It's very clean, and the staff are all friendly. There is a free breakfast in the restaurant on the top floor. The food is okay, but it's the same every day and by the end of the first week I was bored enough to start skipping breakfast. But the views from the restaurant are spectacular! One side looks over Taksim Square and the other side has views of the Bosphorus Strait. My room was small. I had 2 single beds without enough room to hide my suitcase. But my travelling companions had larger rooms, and mine was okay for just me. I also had problems with the water, it took a long time to get hot water. I was also unable to connect to the internet from my room, but I had an old laptop, and again my travelling companions were luckier than I. The furnishings were nice and modern. I had a desk and armoire, and the bed had a featherbed. Speaking of friendly staff, someone saw me going to one of the other rooms in my sock feet, and the next day the maid had left slippers for me! The location in Taksim Square is an ideal location for exploring Istanbul. It's near most of the foreign embassies. It's also the one location in the city that taxi drivers never get lost trying to find. Across from the hotel is the top of Istiklal Caddesi, a busy shopping street with hundreds of opions for meals. It was busy as late as midnight every day, but my room in the back of the hotel was silent.

HotelInfo.Name: Taxim Hill Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Siraselviler Cad. No.5 Taksim Meydani, Istanbul 80090, Turkey
